item.description:
It is now hunting season for deer with regular firearms so you would be smart to have some sort of blaze orange on both you and your dog(s).

Mt. Cardigan features a bald summit due to a massive 1855 forest fire. Once known as "Old Baldy," the eastern slopes feature non-lift served alpine ski trails. The summit features views in all directions (360 degrees).

This hike will be cohosted by Dave, Cheryl and Chuck.  None of the co-hosts have done all of this hike before so don't come on this hike if you don't have a sense of adventure.  The co-hosts will have references, maps and a GPS with them however.  Some people who are signed up to come on this hike may have done Mt Cardigan before but may have used different trails to get to the summit than the route the co-hosts have planned for this hike. So if you have a sense of adventure and aren't afraid of the unknown please join us for this hike and help prevent us from getting "lost".

This is a moderate hike and you should be getting some sort of regular exercise to do this. The total hike is 4.7 miles with an elevation gain of 1,700 feet which means even though the West Ridge Trail is considered the easiest trail to get to the summit it is still going to be steadily uphill most of the way.

Directions heading North on I-93 just above Concord, NH:

1. Take exit 17 for US-4 toward US-3/​NH-132/​Penacook/​Boscawen     0.3 mi

2. Turn right onto US-4 W/​Hoit Rd Continue to follow US-4 W            39.8 mi

3. Sharp right onto Parker St.                                                             0.6 mi

4. Turn right onto Cardigan Mountain Rd/​Orange Rd. Continue to follow Cardigan Mountain Rd                                                                  3.4 mi

5. Turn left to stay on Cardigan Mountain Rd                                       0.6 mi 

The trail head for this hike is in Mt.Cardigan State Park.  We will use the West Ridge Trail (1.5 mi.) which is considered the easiest trail to get to the summit of Mt. Cardigan.  From there we will us a 0.6 section of the Mowglis Trail to do a line hike to the summit of Firescrew Mountain and return back the same way (round trip 1.2 miles).  We will descend back to the parking lot a different way using a 0.2 mile section of the Clark Trail and then the whole of the South Ridge Trail (1.3 mi.).  While on the South Ridge Trail we will be passing over South Peak and Rimrock.  Then we use a 0.5 mile section of the West Ridge Trail we have already been on going up the mountain to return to the parking lot.

So everyone is covered by the liability waiver any guest you want to bring should sign up as a member to come on the hike. Minors would need a waiver signed by a parent/guardian.
